newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines has no place for Cunanan's body-senator.
newsitem.headline: Philippines has no place for Cunanan's body-senator.

text.p: The body of Andrew Cunanan, the alleged killer of fashion king Gianni Versace, should not be allowed to be buried in his Filipino father's homeland, a leading Philippine senator said on Friday.
Cunanan committed suicide on Wednesday in Miami following a massive search after he was alleged to have killed Versace and four other men.

"Andrew Cunanan is a product of American culture and owes nothing to his Bulacan roots. They should bury him in San Diego where he grew up and where his friends are," deputy Senate President Blas Ople said in a statement.
Both Ople and Cunanan's father are natives of Bulacan, a province north of the Philippine capital.
There has been no word yet on where Cunanan will be buried
"Andrew Cunanan's burial in Bulacan will draw global attention to this province on the eve of the glorious centennial of Philippine independence, which was formalised in Malolos (in Bulacan).
"Bulacan does not deserve to be part of Cunanan's global notoriety," Ople said.
Cunanan, called a "high class prostitute" by his mother, is alleged to have begun his killing spree in April.

Cornered in a houseboat a few miles from the elegant oceanfront mansion where he is accused of shooting Versace on July 15, the 27-year-old fugitive put a pistol in his mouth after a caretaker stumbled upon him, and pulled the trigger.
